location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from John MacLeod, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to the Officer Commanding the 1st (Marine) Battalion 11th Regiment, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter concerns the relieved guards of the Residency who are proceeding to Head Quarters on board the ship Felicitusas per an enclosed roll of names, entitled 'Roll of men of the 1st (Marine) Battalion 11th Regiment proceeding from Bushere [Bushire] to Bombay', which lists thirty names with their positions and ranks (f. 15). MacLeod also mentions the sickness of one of the men and requests that another be sent as soon as possible to replace him. He also mentions another man who lost his sword during landing from the ship and comments on the good behaviour and usefulness of the men.
